text: Rosie the Riveter is a cultural icon in the United States. She was an icon of women that worked in factories and shipyards during World War II. She was in a World War II poster titled "We Can Do It!". She is often used as a symbol of feminism in this image. Pictures of working women were used many times during World War II. The US government wanted women to work during the war. In 1944 a movie called Rosie the Riveter was released. Rosie the Riveter became associated with a real woman called Naomi Parker, who inspired the icon.Naomi Parker Fraley, the Real Rosie the Riveter, Dies at 96 Rosie the Riveter was named after Rosalind P. Walter."Rosie the Riveter and GBBGC." Locust Valley, New York: Grenville Baker Boys and Girls Club, March 12, 2018. In 1997, the Rosie the Riveter Memorial Committee was started. ==References== Category:Feminism
title: Rosie the Riveter
